'''Ian Beattie''' is a Northern Irish actor. He attended Methodist College Belfast. He is best known for playing the role of Antigonus in [[wikipedia:Oliver Stone|Oliver Stone]]'s movie ''[[wikipedia:Alexander (film)|Alexander]]'', and has also appeared in ''[[wikipedia:The Tudors|The Tudors]]'', ''[[wikipedia:Mo (film)|Mo]]'' and ''[[wikipedia:Space Truckers|Space Truckers]]''.

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' he is playing Ser [[Meryn Trant]], a [[knight]] of the [[Kingsguard]]. He was announced in the role on 14 October 2010. He initially appeared as a guest star in the [[Season 1|first season]] and returned in this role for the [[Season 2|second]],Â [[Season 3|third]], and [[Season 4|fourth]] season.

His father could possibly be credited for bringing alive the student entertainment scene in Belfast during a very dark time in the city's history with The Crescent Bar.  Prior to The Crescent there really was nowhere for Queens University students to go where they could be guaranteed a safe night out. His Father (TJ) changed all of that with a run down bar in the city's Sandy Row area where sawdust and soul was served up on a nightly basis.
